qas.question: What are the most visited places in Shimla?

qas.question: What has the government done to meet maximum urban population standards?
What products does Shimla forbid the use of?
What is no health center without in Himachal Pradesh?

context: Himachal Pradesh is spread across valleys, and 90% of the population lives in <a0_0>villages and towns<a0_0/>. However, the state has achieved 100% hygiene and practically no single house is without <a1_0><b9_0>a toilet<b9_0/><a1_0/>. The villages are well connected to <a2_0>roads, public health centers, and now with Lokmitra kendra using high-speed broadband<a2_0/>. Shimla district has maximum urban population of 25%. According to a 2005 Transparency International survey, Himachal Pradesh is <b5_0>ranked the <a3_0>second-least corrupt state in the country<b5_0/> after Kerala<a3_0/>. <a4_0><b6_0>The hill stations<a4_0/> of the state<b6_0/> are among the most visited places in the country. <b7_0>The government has successfully imposed environmental protection and tourism development<b7_0/>, meeting European standards, and it is the only state which forbids the use of <b8_0>polyethylene and tobacco products<b8_0/>.[citation needed]
